nodes.name: G-Mode Morph Junction Indirect (In Morph Tunnel)
nodes.note: Represents being in the morph tunnel with G-Mode and morph or artificial morph, in indirect G-Mode

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Caterpillar
note: Use the frozen Zero as a platform or other means to get up to the top half of the room. This takes about 3 minutes.
The Zero only moves on camera and the camera scrolls when exiting the morph tunnel.
Let the Zero lead through the morph tunnel or wait for the it to get very close to Samus before touching the scroll block at the exit.

strats.name: Leave With Spark (Gate Open)
strats.note: Slow rolling or getting a fast mockball work equally well.
devNote: One tile longer runway could be used if the door to the right of the gate were known to be unlocked

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero
note: It takes around 3 minutes to get the Zero to this door.
The Zero only moves on camera and the camera scrolls when exiting the morph tunnel.
Let the Zero lead through the morph tunnel or wait for the it to get very close to Samus before touching the scroll block at the exit.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero (Zero Damage Boost Up)
note: It takes around 3 minutes to get the Zero to this door.
Let the Zero climb the right wall and jump on top of it in Morph Ball form to bounce up to the Cacatac platform.
The Zero only moves on camera and the camera scrolls when exiting the morph tunnel.
Let the Zero lead through the morph tunnel or wait for the it to get very close to Samus before touching the scroll block at the exit.
detailNote: One setup is to do regular jumps while aiming down until the camera stops lowering, and then let the Zero move off camera.
And then crouch jump and morph directly into it, while holding right.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero (Cacatac Damage Boost Up)
note: It takes around 3 minutes to get the Zero to this door.
Crouch jump to touch a well timed Cacatac spike at the peak of Samus' jump.
Use a neutral damage boost to gain some height.
At the peak of the boost, down grab the ledge.
The Zero only moves on camera and the camera scrolls when exiting the morph tunnel.
Let the Zero lead through the morph tunnel or wait for the it to get very close to Samus before touching the scroll block at the exit.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Backtrack
note: Only doable if entering the room from 5 and backtracking.
Only worthwhile to go kill the Zeros for PBs and Cacatacs for Supers.
strats.devNote: It is possible to roll off of the platform above to avoid a mid-air morph.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (HiJump)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Leave With Runway (Shot Blocks Intact)
note: Runway not usable if the shot blocks are broken.
Those blocks are not an obstacle right now, but there's no need to destroy them except when travelling between nodes 2 and 3.

strats.name: Leave With Runway (Shot Blocks Broken) - Frozen Caterpillar
note: Use the frozen Zero as a platform or other means to get up to the top half of the room.
This takes about 4 minutes, but fortunately isn't often necessary.
The Zero only moves on camera and the camera scrolls when exiting the morph tunnel.
Let the Zero lead through the morph tunnel or wait for the it to get very close to Samus before touching the scroll block at the exit.

strats.name: Zero Farm
devNote: Resetting at the bottom of the room (node 3) is covered in a separate 3->3 strat.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero
note: It takes around 4 minutes to get the Zero to this door with Morph, or 90 seconds with 2 Supers.
The Zero only moves on camera and the camera scrolls when exiting the morph tunnel.
Let the Zero lead through the morph tunnel or wait for the it to get very close to Samus before touching the scroll block at the exit.
To speed this up and avoid the Morph requirement, use a Super when the Zero is at the tip of the platform extending out below the morph tunnel.
The Zero will fall onto a lower platform, and another Super can be used to make it fall on the left platform.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero (Zero Damage Boost Up)
note: It takes around 4 minutes to get the Zero to this door.
Let the Zero climb the right wall and jump on top of it in Morph Ball form to bounce up to the Cacatac platform.
The Zero only moves on camera and the camera scrolls when exiting the morph tunnel.
Let the Zero lead through the morph tunnel or wait for the it to get very close to Samus before touching the scroll block at the exit.
detailNote: One setup is to do regular jumps while aiming down until the camera stops lowering, and then let the Zero move off camera.
And then crouch jump and morph directly into it, while holding right.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero (Cacatac Damage Boost Up)
note: It takes around 4 minutes to get the Zero to this door.
Crouch jump to touch a well timed Cacatac spike at the peak of Samus' jump.
Use a neutral damage boost to gain some height.
At the peak of the boost, down grab the ledge.
The Zero only moves on camera and the camera scrolls when exiting the morph tunnel.
Let the Zero lead through the morph tunnel or wait for the it to get very close to Samus before touching the scroll block at the exit.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Frozen Caterpillar
strats.note: Let the Caterpillar out and freeze it as a platform.

strats.name: Cacatac Spike Boost
note: Crouch jump to touch a well timed Cacatac spike at the peak of Samus' jump.
Use a neutral damage boost to gain some height.
At the peak of the boost, down grab the ledge.

strats.name: Caterpillar Boost
note: Let the Zero (Caterpillar) climb the right wall and jump on top of it in Morph Ball form to bounce up to the Cacatac platform.
detailNote: One setup is to do regular jumps while aiming down until the camera stops lowering, and then let the Zero move off camera.
And then crouch jump and morph directly into it, while holding right.

strats.name: Tricky Dash Jump
note: Carefully kill the Cacatac, then it is possible to get up with just Speed Booster.
With Samus's back against the door, jump just before hitting the right wall. This is not easier with the door open.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit
strats.note: To save energy, spark diagonally to the right to hit the ledge below the doorframe.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (HiJump)
note: Ledge grab precisely in front of the Cacatac, and jump immediately before it would hit you.
devNote: One runway tile is considered unusable, in order to be able quickly jump up (without turning around) after gaining a shinecharge.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Wall Jump)
note: Ledge grab precisely in front of the Cacatac, and jump immediately before it would hit you.
devNote: One runway tile is considered unusable, in order to be able quickly jump up (without turning around) after gaining a shinecharge.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge (HiJump)
note: Ledge grab precisely in front of the Cacatac, and jump immediately before it would hit you.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge (Wall Jump)
note: Ledge grab precisely in front of the Cacatac, and jump immediately before it would hit you.

strats.name: Shinespark, Come in Shinecharged
strats.note: Diagonal shinespark on entry, or move to the right a bit first to save some Energy.
strats.devNote: Shinesparking from the right a bit is not modeled as the Cacatacs can be farmed.

strats.name: Speedy Jump
strats.note: With a 10 tile runway in the adjacent room, Samus will need to jump after the shot blocks. With a longer runway the positioning is more lenient.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (HiJump)
Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Wall Jump)
note: Ledge grab precisely in front of the Cacatac, and jump immediately before it would hit you.
If the shinespark wind-up is activated as early as possible, then a Cacatac spike hit will be taken.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue (Full Runway)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue (Short Runway)
note: If the Cac moves left and is in the way, it can be killed with temp blue as Samus unmorphs to land.
Otherwise, after landing, move quickly to jump up to the next platform, to avoid being hit by the Cac or its projectiles.

blocks.note: The Moat, Double Chamber, Wrecked Ship Energy Tank Room

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero

Frozen Caterpillar
strats.note: Let the Caterpillar out and freeze it as a platform.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave Shinecharged (Wall Jump)
Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (HiJump)
Come in Shinecharged, Leave With Spark (Wall Jump)
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Leave With Runway - Frozen Caterpillar
strats.note: Use the frozen caterpillar as a platform or other means to get up to the top half of the room.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero
strats.devNote: It takes around 50 seconds to get the Zero to this door.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero (Zero Damage Boost Up to the Door)
strats.note: Let the Caterpillar climb the right wall and jump on top of it in Morph Ball form to bounce up to the Cacatac platform.
detailNote: One setup is to do regular jumps while aiming down until the camera stops lowering, and then let the Zero move off camera.
And then crouch jump and morph directly into it, while holding right.
strats.devNote: It takes around 50 seconds to get the Zero to this door.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero (Cacatac Damage Boost Up to the Door)
note: Let the Caterpillar climb the right wall and then use a Cacatac spike to boost up to the same level.
Crouch jump to touch a well timed Cacatac spike at the peak of Samus' jump.
Use a neutral damage boost to gain some height.
At the peak of the boost, down grab the ledge.
strats.devNote: It takes around 50 seconds to get the Zero to this door.

strats.name: G-Mode Up the Elevator
strats.devNote: There could be an artificial morph IBJ option, but that would just bypass a crouch jump + down grab requirement.

strats.name: Cacatac and Zero Farm
devNote: It is possible to roll off of the platform above to avoid a mid-air morph.
FIXME: add a Cac-only farm since it can be done with fewer requirements.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero
strats.note: It takes around 2 minutes to get the Zero to this door.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero (Zero Damage Boost Up)
note: It takes around 2 minutes to get the Zero to this door.
Let the Zero climb the right wall and jump on top of it in Morph Ball form to bounce up to the Cacatac platform.
detailNote: One setup is to do regular jumps while aiming down until the camera stops lowering, and then let the Zero move off camera.
And then crouch jump and morph directly into it, while holding right.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Zero (Catatac Damage Boost Up)
note: It takes around 2 minutes to get the Zero to this door.
Crouch jump to touch a well timed Cacatac spike at the peak of Samus' jump.
Use a neutral damage boost to gain some height.
At the peak of the boost, down grab the ledge.

strats.name: G-Mode Indirect Despawn the Gate, Open Gate
strats.note: Exit G-Mode while under the gate to open it without a Super.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Despawn Gate, Carry G-Mode Up Elevator
Carry G-Mode Back Up the Elevator
Exit G-Mode
strats.note: Exit G-Mode near the door to pass the gate.

strats.name: Exit G-Mode, Open Gate
note: Exit G-Mode while under the gate to open it without a Super.
The camera will not scroll through the morph tunnel, but Samus will still be visible;
position where Samus appears to be standing on air one tile to the right of the ledge.
It is possible to test the location, as there is a block on the ceiling one tile left of the gate.
With Morph, Samus can then fix the camera by going through the morph tunnel.
